readingMnemonic:
The reading for a <kanji>can</kanji> is かん, which seems impossibly easy. If that isn't close enough for you, picture this:

Genghis <reading>Khan</reading> (かん) is drinking out of a tin can. He glug glug glugs, gasps, and wipes his face. He holds out the can, "Khan made cans," and winks.
meaningMnemonic: The radical <radical>can</radical> is the same as the kanji <kanji>can</kanji>. Usually when we talk about a can with this kanji we mean a <kanji>tin can</kanji>, though.
